title: ‘We took hot girl summer too far’: The best signs from the global climate protests
text:
People in London gathered for the global climate strike on Sept. 20. The protester's sign about winter is a reference to the popular HBO show "Game of Thrones." (Karla Adam/The Washington Post)

Youths from more than 150 countries ditched the classroom Friday and hit the streets to urge world leaders to take serious action against climate change.

Millions of young people marched in places from Moscow to Manhattan, where many showcased their concerns through witty protest signs. The global march comes just ahead of a U.N. climate summit Monday. We scoured Twitter, combed the wires and chatted with a few of our staffers on site, and rounded up some of the best signs we saw.



A youth activist holds a sign during a Global Climate Strike demonstration on Friday in San Francisco. (Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)



Sixth-grader Tatum Parker Mach holds a sign made by her ninth-grade sister Nava Parker Mach during a climate march in Washington, D.C., on Sept. 20, 2019. (Juliet Eilperin/The Washington Post)

“Y’all bout to go extinct like me.” More signs from Austin’s #ClimateStrike, where dozens of students have walked out of school to protest. pic.twitter.com/Ve2MsnX77Q — Nicole Cobler (@nicolecobler) September 20, 2019

“When leaders act like kids, kids act like leaders.” #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/Ee8MBO6l4Y — Anand Giridharadas (@AnandWrites) September 20, 2019

The New York subway system is crammed, and I mean crammed, with people headed to #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/SpWLTzltnO — Bill McKibben (@billmckibben) September 20, 2019

Perhaps my favorite sign from the #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/qaxsL3WepN — Darcy Jae (@darcyjae) September 20, 2019

The kids are alright. #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/pnDkeKmwXe — J Λ M Ξ S (@jamesglynn) September 20, 2019



Brazilians hold signs during a protest at XV square in Rio de Janeiro on Friday. (Mauro Pimentel/AFP/Getty Images)



Protesters hold signs during a Global Climate Strike demonstration in Mexico City. (Alejandro Cegarra/Bloomberg)

If you’re looking for more, try the #ClimateStrike tab on Twitter.
